text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to mention that US courts apply the \"manifest disregard of the law\" doctrine only in domestic arbitration and not in foreign award enforcement under the New York Convention. The candidate answer discusses potential vulnerabilities, including \"Manifest disregard or bias\" (under the section on practical vulnerabilities), but it does not explicitly state the established legal principle that the manifest disregard doctrine is generally inapplicable to the enforcement of foreign arbitral awards under the New York Convention (which is governed by Article V defenses, not the Federal Arbitration Act's domestic standards).", "criterion_id": "0b829d90-0ded-4a7c-9508-72d4252c8baa"}
